conbody.p: The Technicolor DDS implementation has the following features that are useful for debugging user- as well as DDS-specific code and data:

ol.li: A debug command handler (shell) can easily be attached to application code.
An application debugger (gdb, ddd, etc.) can 'call' Technicolor DDS debug commands.

Any Technicolor DDS application can optionally be verified/monitored remotely using the telnet protocol to a built-in debug server giving access to the Debug shell. This debug server is either started automatically, or spawned on request of applications.
The Debug shell can give detailed information on memory usage, created as well as discovered DDS entities, and it allows detailed inspection of History Cache data.
RTPS message tracing can be enabled for any topic, even the builtin Discovery topics.
